conclusion: Identify the given information: p-V image shows change process from state A to B to C; temperature in state C is 300K; find temperature in state A.
Use the ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
Since mass is constant, n is constant; compare states using ideal gas law.
Pressure in state A is 4 x 10^5 Pa and volume is 2 x 10^-3 m^3; in state C, pressure is 2 x 10^5 Pa and volume is 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Set up equations for state A and C using ideal gas law: PA * VA = n * RA * TA and PC * VC = n * RC * TC.
Divide the equations: (PA * VA) / (PC * VC) = TA / TC.
Temperature of gas in state A is 300K.
